items.title: Forget ice runs with Anker’s SOLIX EverFrost 2 58L dual-zone electric cooler at $720 (Reg. up to $1,100, Today only)
items.summary:
As part of its Deals of the Day, Best Buy is offering the Anker SOLIX EverFrost 2 58L Cordless Dual-Zone Electric Cooler at $719.99 shipped, which beats out Amazon’s current pricing by $179. While it carries an $1,100 MSRP, you’ll more regularly find it around $900 these days, with discounts having gone as low as $719 since it hit the market in March, with that price having only appeared once back during July’s Prime Day event. You’re looking at the next-best rate that only lasts through the rest of the day, giving you up to $380 off the MSRP and equips your outdoor gatherings with a reliable means to keep things chilled and/or frozen. Learn more below or by checking out our hands-on review here.

items.title: General Intuition lands $134M seed to teach agents spatial reasoning using video game clips
items.summary: Late last year, OpenAI reportedly tried to buy Medal and its vast trove of video game data for $500M. Today, the company spun out a frontier research lab that's using that data to build AI agents that understand how they move through space and time, a concept called spatial-temporal reasoning.

items.title: Amazon launches pay-per-visit virtual healthcare service for kids
items.summary: Amazon’s One Medical is expanding into pediatric care with a new pay-per-visit virtual health service for children ages 2 to 11. Starting at $29 for message-based visits and $49 for video calls, the service treats common conditions like pink eye, eczema, and rashes, and also handles medication renewals

items.title: Heads up! Microsoft’s Xbox Ally and Ally X handhelds now available and shipping from $600
items.summary:
Update: Microsoft’s new Xbox ROG Ally and ROG Ally X PC gaming handhelds are now available to purchase. Best Buy currently has them in stock and shipping with prices starting at $599.99 shipped for the standard Xbox ROG Ally. More details in the original post below.

A little over a month after Xbox confirmed the release date of its upcoming gaming handhelds, the ROG Ally and ROG Ally X are now available for pre-order. That also puts an end to all the speculation around pricing. The ROG Ally is priced at $599.99 shipped, while the more powerful ROG Ally X comes in at $999.99 shipped. The standard ROG Ally, which comes in white, can be pre-ordered from Amazon, Best Buy, and Walmart. The beefier ROG Ally X, available in black, can be grabbed from Best Buy and Microsoft’s official store. Both of these models start shipping on October 16. Head below for more details.

items.title: Huge $150 discount knocks Samsung’s 8TB T5 EVO portable SSD down to its lowest price today
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Samsung’s 8TB T5 EVO portable SSD down to $399.99 shipped. Don’t forget to clip the on-page coupon to see the discounted price during checkout. Originally $650, this 8TB variant of Samsung’s popular SSD has lately been sitting at the $550 mark at Amazon. That means you’re looking at a straight-up $150 discount on it today, matching the lowest price we saw toward the end of last year – and it’s also far below Samsung’s own $600 listing at the moment. Head below for more details.

more…

items.title: Amazon just knocked 50% off anime classic Akira in 4K UHD digital, now just $5
items.summary:
Akira (4K UHD Digital)

Buy for $5 (Reg. $10)

What we love

This one is such a classic you might prefer to just grab physical copy for the collection, but at just $5 you can land the digital copy from Amazon Prime Video to keep in 4K UHD digital resolution. This is a no-brainer steal if you ask me.

Amazon is now offering a giant $400 off Moto’s latest plus model flip phone to deliver a new Amazon all-time low and the best deals we have ever tracked.

items.title: M5 iPad Pro pre-order deals: $50 off for Best Buy members, configs as low as $499 w/ trade
items.summary:
As we detailed yesterday, Apple’s brand new M5 MacBook Pro and M5-powered iPad Pro are now up for pre-order at Amazon, Best Buy, and elsewhere. We went over some trade-in options for the M5 MacBook Pro already, and now it’s time for the iPad Pro – Best Buy is offering members $50 off the new lineup with now trade-ins and units as low as $499 with one.
